intro: Eugenia schadrackiana, commonly known as the Schadrack's eugenia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and glossy, dark green leaves. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its habitat in the dense rainforest, it plays a role in supporting local biodiversity and ecological balance.
